member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer
member.summary: Represents the base class for annotation layer types. Annotations will usually disable some of the default hover/touch behaviors of the chart when they are introduced to the series collection. In return they provide some valuable information as the cursor is moved by hovering over the chart, or performing a press-hold-drag interaction in touch mode.

The index to get a distance from.
The axis the represents the indexes.

member.summary: Helps to obtain the a series value that is close to the provided world position, if possible. Otherwise returns NaN.

The category offset, if applicable.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Series.Legend
member.summary: Gets or sets a legend for the current series object.
member.remarks:
If the Legend property is not set, the series will use the setting according to the parent XamDataChart's Legend property.
This is generally expressed as an element name binding, as the Legend must exist at some other position in the layout. This property only indicates which Legend to use and will not alone cause the legend to be visible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Series.LegendItem
member.summary: Gets the legend item associated with the current series object.
member.remarks: The legend item control is created according to the LegendItemTemplate on-demand by the series object itself.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets or sets whether this series interacts with the chart legend.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.CursorPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets the world position to use instead of the mouse position for this annotation layer. If you set this value, rather than responding to the mouse cursor, this layer will be fixed on the provided world position. A world position has x and y values that range from 0 to 1 that represent the global position of the cursor relative to the entire ranges of the axes. The default of (NaN, NaN) means that the layer should react to mouse movement.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.IsDefaultCrosshairDisabled
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the series viewer's default crosshair should be disabled by the presence of this layer.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolarAxisRenderingManager.GetClosestRadiusValue(Infragistics.Portable.Rect)
member.summary: Determines the smallest radius that is visible in the current view into the chart.
member.param: The window rectangle.
member.returns: The radius value.
member.remarks:
This makes use of the fact that the view into the chart is aligned on the cartesian axes.
So, if the center point of the chart is inside the viewable space, the minimum radius is 0.
If the view into the chart is scrolled above or below the center point, such that the center point is in the X range of the view, then the closest radius is just the distance to the top or bottom edge of the window rectangle.
Similarly, if the view into the chart is left of right of the center point, such that the center point is in the Y range of the view, then the closest radius is just the distance to the left of right edge of the window rectangle.
In the case where the view is deeper into the quadrants of the space, and the center point is neither in the X or Y range of the view, then we simply need to determine what the distance is to the closest corner of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolarAxisRenderingManager.GetFurthestRadiusValue(Infragistics.Portable.Rect)
member.summary: Determines the furthest radius value that is viewable in the current view into the chart.
member.param: The window rectangle.
member.returns: The radius value.
member.remarks: In all cases the furthest distance will just be the distance to the furthest corner of the viewing rectangle in scaled viewport space.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.VerticalAnchoredCategorySeries.GetSeriesValuePosition(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available position within the series that has the best value match for the world position provided.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get a value position for
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The position in question, or NaN,NaN if no valid position is available.

member.summary: If possible, will return the best available main value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowRect
member.summary: A rectangle representing the portion of the SeriesViewer currently in view.
member.remarks: A rectangle at X=0, Y=0 with a Height and Width of 1 implies the entire plotting area is in view. A Height and Width of .5 would imply that the view is halfway zoomed in.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowResponse
member.summary: The response to user panning and zooming: whether to update the view immediately while the user action is happening, or to defer the update to after the user action is complete. The user action will be an action such as a mouse drag which causes panning and/or zooming to occur.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowRectMinWidth
member.summary:
Sets or gets the minimum width that the window rect is allowed to reach before being clamped. Decrease this value if you want to allow for further zooming into the viewer. If this value is lowered too much it can cause graphical corruption due to floating point arithmetic inaccuracy.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialSeries.GetSeriesValuePosition(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available position within the series that has the best value match for the world position provided.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get a value position for
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The position in question, or NaN,NaN if no valid position is available.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialSeries.GetSeriesValue(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available main value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, when searching for the best avaialble value any unknown values will be skipped.
member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Portable.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource
member.summary: Represents the data contract between a financial series and the decoupled calculation responsibilities which implement its mathmatical logic.
member.remarks: The FinancialCalculationDataSource contract represents the subset of data which needs to be provided in order to test or run a calculation, and its intentionally a subset of the information available to the series, in order to make calculation strategies more easily testable and usable in isolation to the financial series container.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseStrategyBasedIndicator
member.summary: Financial indicator base class for doing calculating an itemwize indicator.
member.remarks: An itemwise indicator's individual values don't depend on any other values in the collection so can always be independantly recalculated. Also, because of this, the base class handles all the looping logic and inheritors only need to provide the actual calculation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnchoredRadialSeries.GetPreviousOrExactIndex(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Getting the previous index that is near a given world position, if possible, otherwise NaN.
member.param: The world position to use in searching.
Should unknown values be skipped when searching.
member.returns: The found index, otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnchoredRadialSeries.GetNextOrExactIndex(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Getting the next index that is near a given world position, if possible, otherwise NaN.
member.param: The world position to use in searching.
Should unknown values be skipped when searching.
member.returns: The found index, otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnchoredRadialSeries.GetDistanceToIndex(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Int32,Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Axis,Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ScalerParams,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a distance value (not necessarily pixels), that indicates how 'close' a world position is to an indexed value in the series. Not every series can necessarily answer this question, it can't or the world position or index is invalid, NaN will be returned.
member.param: The world position for which to get a distance.
The index to get a distance to.
member.returns: A distance value to the world position.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnchoredRadialSeries.GetSeriesValue(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available main value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, when searching for the best avaialble value any unknown values will be skipped.
member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnchoredRadialSeries.GetSeriesValuePosition(Infragistics.Portable.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available position within the series that has the best value match for the world position provided.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get a value position for
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The position in question, or NaN,NaN if no valid position is available.

member.summary: Gets or sets a legend for the current series object.

If the Legend property is not set, the series will use the setting according to the parent UltraDataChart's Legend property.
This property only indicates which Legend to use and will not alone cause the legend to be visible.

member.returns: True if the specified item could be displayed.

member.summary: Gets the actual shadow blur used by the series.

member.summary: Gets actual the drop shadow color used by the series.

member.summary: Gets the actual drop shadow x-offset applied to the series.

member.summary: Gets the actual drop shadow y-offset applied to the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.EndCap
member.summary: The style of the end point of any lines or polylines representing this series.
member.remarks: Not every series type has a line at which it would be appropriate to display an end cap, so this property does not affect every series type. LineSeries, for example, is affected by EndCap, but ColumnSeries is not.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualEndCap
member.summary: Gets the actual end cap used by the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.LegendItemVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the legend item visibility for the current series object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualLegendItemVisibility
member.summary: Gets the actual visibility of the legend items in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.MarkerBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush that specifies how the current series object's marker interiors are painted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualMarkerBrush
member.summary: Gets the actual marker brush of the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.MarkerOutline
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush that specifies how the current series object's marker outlines are painted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualMarkerOutline
member.summary: Gets the actual marker outline of the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.MarkerType
member.summary: Gets or sets the marker type for the current series object.
member.remarks: If the MarkerTemplate property is set, the setting of the MarkerType property will be ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualMarkerType
member.summary: Gets the actual marker type set used in the series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the Name of the stacked fragment.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Opacity of the stacked fragment.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualOpacity
member.summary: Gets the series opacity.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.Outline
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush to use for the outline of the series.
member.remarks: Some series types, such as LineSeries, do not display outlines. Therefore, this property does not affect some charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualOutline
member.summary: Gets the series outline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.AreaFillOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the AreaFillOpacity of the stacked fragment. This property only applies for area-like series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualAreaFillOpacity
member.summary: Gets the series ActualAreaFillOpacity. This property only applies for area-like series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.RadiusX
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-radius of the ellipse that is used to round the corners of the column. This only applies to Bar and Column series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualRadiusX
member.summary: Gets the actual corner radius of the series

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.RadiusY
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-radius of the ellipse that is used to round the corners of the column. This only applies to Bar and Column series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualRadiusY
member.summary: Gets the actual corner radius of the series

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.StartCap
member.summary: The style of the starting point of any lines or polylines representing this series.
member.remarks: Not every series type has a line at which it would be appropriate to display a start cap, so this property does not affect every series type. LineSeries, for example, is affected by StartCap, but ColumnSeries is not.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualStartCap
member.summary: Gets the series start cap.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the current series object's line thickness.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.ActualThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of this stacked fragment.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.StackedFragmentSeries.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the Title property.
member.remarks: The legend item control is created according to the Title on-demand by the series object itself.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether this series should take up an index for auto brush coloring.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.AnnotationLayer.UseLegend
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this series interacts with the chart legend.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.AnnotationLayer.CursorPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the world position to use instead of the mouse position for this annotation layer. If you set this value, rather than responding to the mouse cursor, this layer will be fixed on the provided world position. A world position has x and y values that range from 0 to 1 that represent the global position of the cursor relative to the entire ranges of the axes. The default of (NaN, NaN) means that the layer should react to mouse movement.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.AnnotationLayer.IsDefaultCrosshairDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the series viewer's default crosshair should be disabled by the presence of this layer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.AnnotationLayer.IsDefaultCrosshairBehaviorDisabled
member.summary: Gets whether or not the default crosshair behavior is disabled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.AnnotationLayer.IsIndexed
member.summary: Gets if the series uses an index, which can be used to auto-assign it a color.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.AnnotationLayer.IsUsableInLegend
member.summary: Gets if the series should appear in any legends.

member.summary: Gets whether this series is an annotation layer.

member.summary: Gets the EffectiveViewport rectangle, representing the effective viewport area after margins have been subtracted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.SeriesViewer.ContentViewport
member.summary: Represents the subsetted area within the viewport into which content should be mapped. This is the projection of the current EffectiveViewport into the viewport at current zoom level.

member.summary: Gets or sets the duration the highlighting/de-highlighting effects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.SeriesViewer.WindowResponse
member.summary: The response to user panning and zooming: whether to update the view immediately while the user action is happening, or to defer the update to after the user action is complete. The user action will be an action such as a mouse drag which causes panning and/or zooming to occur.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.SeriesViewer.WindowRectMinWidth
member.summary: Sets or gets the minimum width that the window rect is allowed to reach before being clamped. Decrease this value if you want to allow for further zooming into the viewer. If this value is lowered too much it can cause graphical corruption due to floating point arithmetic inaccuracy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.WindowsForms.strings.AnnotationLayer_CursorPosition_Property
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Gets or sets the world position to use instead of the mouse position for this annotation layer. If you set this value, rather than responding to the mouse cursor, this layer will be fixed on the provided world position. A world position has x and y values that range from 0 to 1 that represent the global position of the cursor relative to the entire ranges of the axes.
